answers.answer: Hi,It is my understanding that 95% of people with Hashimoto's disease have thyroid antibodies greater than the upper level of the reference range.    It doesn't look like you do but you could be one of the other 5%.What was the pathology of your thyroid?  Again, it is my understanding that there can be coexisting thyroid cancer with Hashi's (some say Hashi's increases risk of developing thyroid cancer).  If you did have Hashi's then the thyroid would have shown inflammatory changes consistent with Hashi's as well as the cancer.One of the reasons you might want to know if you had Hashi's is because there can an association with other autoimmune diseases --for example, pernicious anemia, type I diabetes and celiac disease.  I have Hashi's and also have vitiligo (white skin patches) and was just tested for celiac disease.Just ask your doctor what the pathology showed and you should know.Good luck

The only pathology report I have is on the size and type of cancer I had.Results from pathology showed that the larger nodule was benign follicular adenoma ( 35mm diameter), while the smaller nodule 5mm was a papillary cariconoma.  Thus the procedure was converted to a  complete thyroidectomy.The cancer was very small 5mm pap cancer with 2 other pap carcinoma on the other lobe, the largest being 3mm. The cancer was multi-focal.Tg is <1I have delayed having RAI until I really need it..I have asked my doctor about it and he doesn't know what it means..

question: The Thyroglobulin antibodies is 18 IU/ml (0-150)My Thyroid Peroxidase is 7 IU/ml (0150)If so does it really matter now since I have had my TT a couple of months ago..
title: Did I have Hashi' s before Thyroid Cancer
